{"abstract": "The activist investor Carl Icahn has a point when he says that splitting eBay in two would make investors about 15 percent richer, writes Robert Cyran of Reuters Breakingviews.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2014/02/27/paypal-has-the-maturity-to-go-out-on-its-own/", "snippet": "The activist investor Carl Icahn has a point when he says that splitting eBay in two would make investors about 15 percent richer, writes Robert Cyran of Reuters Breakingviews.", "lead_paragraph": "PayPal has outgrown the warm embrace of its parent eBay. {"abstract": "The styles of the two investors could not be more different. But Jeffrey Goldfarb of Reuters Breakingviews notes that both men beat the market by betting on America, playing hardball and trading on personal brands.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2014/03/03/buffett-and-icahn-birds-of-a-feather/", "snippet": "The styles of the two investors could not be more different. But Jeffrey Goldfarb of Reuters Breakingviews notes that both men beat the market by betting on America, playing hardball and trading on personal brands.", "lead_paragraph": "Warren E. \u00a0Buffett and Carl C. Icahn are inverse investors who correlate in more ways than one. In recently released letters to shareholders, the two billionaires talk up their returns and approaches to deploying capital. Their styles couldn\u2019t be more different, but both beat the market by betting on America, playing hardball and trading on personal brands. Yet their greatest common bond is that neither can be easily replicated.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Buffett and Icahn: Birds of a Feather?", "kicker": "DealBook", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Shareholder Rights and Activism", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Buffett, Warren E", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Icahn, Carl C", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Berkshire Hathaway Inc", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2014-03-03T19:38:25+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Jeffrey Goldfarb", "person": [{"firstname": "Jeffrey", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Goldfarb", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/ab5f1308-3287-520f-af5d-7df3513b20eb", "word_count": 441, "uri": "nyt://article/ab5f1308-3287-520f-af5d-7df3513b20eb"}

{"abstract": "A Fed rule could mean banks need to find an additional $68 billion to limit risk. | The firm chosen to oversee the revamped SAC has links to the fund. | Investors may be souring on I.P.O.\u2019s. | Comcast makes its case for a merger with Time Warner Cable.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2014/04/09/morning-agenda-an-order-for-banks-to-hold-more-capital/", "snippet": "A Fed rule could mean banks need to find an additional $68 billion to limit risk. | The firm chosen to oversee the revamped SAC has links to the fund. | Investors may be souring on I.P.O.\u2019s. | Comcast makes its case for a merger with Time Warner C...", "lead_paragraph": "\u201cFederal regulators on Tuesday approved a simple rule that could do more to rein in Wall Street than most other parts of a sweeping overhaul that has descended on the biggest banks since the financial crisis,\u201d Peter Eavis writes in DealBook. {"abstract": "Citigroup fired 11 more employees over fraud at its Mexican business. | Chipotle\u2019s two chief executives together earned $50 million last year. | The hedge fund industry talks money at a conference in Las Vegas.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2014/05/15/morning-agenda-cleaning-house-at-citi/", "snippet": "Citigroup fired 11 more employees over fraud at its Mexican business. | Chipotle\u2019s two chief executives together earned $50 million last year. | The hedge fund industry talks money at a conference in Las Vegas.", "lead_paragraph": "A SHAKE-UP AT CITIGROUP \u00a0|\u00a0 Citigroup is moving quickly to try to put a costly fraud at its Mexican business in the rearview mirror, firing an additional 11 employees, including four high-ranking executives in Mexico, Michael Corkery and Elisabeth Malkin write in DealBook. On Monday afternoon, the board of the bank was briefed on an internal investigation into the $400 million fraud involving a large Banamex client, and by Tuesday evening, the 11 employees in Mexico were fired.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Cleaning House at Citi", "kicker": "DealBook", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [], "pub_date": "2014-05-15T11:27:40+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Sydney Ember", "person": [{"firstname": "Sydney", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Ember", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/2ea4482b-2159-56e2-b974-3dc642d11fa6", "word_count": 1774, "uri": "nyt://article/2ea4482b-2159-56e2-b974-3dc642d11fa6"}

{"abstract": "Valeant Pharmaceuticals has raised its takeover bid for Allergan. | An offer by Pilgrim\u2019s Pride sets up a potential battle over Hillshire Brands. | Pimco has brought back a former top executive. | Fabrice Tourre said that he would not appeal his case in higher court.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2014/05/28/morning-agenda-valeant-turns-up-the-heat/", "snippet": "Valeant Pharmaceuticals has raised its takeover bid for Allergan. | An offer by Pilgrim\u2019s Pride sets up a potential battle over Hillshire Brands. | Pimco has brought back a former top executive. | Fabrice Tourre said that he would not appeal his c...", "lead_paragraph": "VALEANT RAISES BID FOR ALLERGAN \u00a0|\u00a0 Valeant Pharmaceuticals on Wednesday raised its takeover bid for Allergan, turning up the heat in its pursuit of the Botox maker, Michael J. de la Merced writes in DealBook. The new offer comes on the heels of a separate deal in which Nestl\u00e9 will buy the sales rights to some of Valeant\u2019s skin care products for $1.4 billion. It also arrives a day after Allergan unveiled a more pointed defense against the takeover bid, questioning the sustainability of its unwanted suitor\u2019s business model and stock price. ", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Valeant Turns Up the Heat", "kicker": "DealBook", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [], "pub_date": "2014-05-28T12:06:51+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Sydney Ember", "person": [{"firstname": "Sydney", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Ember", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/d3896317-bde0-5e48-a07b-747a5f59070a", "word_count": 1874, "uri": "nyt://article/d3896317-bde0-5e48-a07b-747a5f59070a"}

Icahn is urging Family Dollar to sell itself. | What the Supreme Court\u2019s ruling on Argentina means. | The bidding war for Alstom appears to be in its final stages. | Markit\u2019s shares ended up 11.3 percent on their first day of trading.", "lead_paragraph": "ICAHN TAKES AIM AT FAMILY DOLLAR \u00a0|\u00a0 The activist investor Carl C. Icahn, who has a long record of aggressively lobbying corporate boards and management, has turned his attention to Family Dollar Stores, the discount retailer in which he holds a 9.39 percent stake, DealBook\u2019s William Alden writes. In a letter to Howard R. Levine, Family Dollar\u2019s chief executive, Mr. Icahn urged the company to self itself \u201cimmediately.\u201d He also demanded that three of his representatives be added to Family Dollar\u2019s board. If the company does not cooperate, Mr. Icahn said he plans to go directly to shareholders with an effort to throw out the entire board.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Morning Agenda: Icahn Takes Aim at Family Dollar", "kicker": "DealBook", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [], "pub_date": "2014-06-20T11:27:24+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Sydney Ember", "person": [{"firstname": "Sydney", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Ember", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/24d6d370-46b7-5d94-9bd7-83fd1bdfdefa", "word_count": 2045, "uri": "nyt://article/24d6d370-46b7-5d94-9bd7-83fd1bdfdefa"}

{"abstract": "Prosecutors\u2019 winning streak in insider trading cases ends. | Citigroup is said to be near a settlement over mortgage investments. | Medtronic\u2019s shareholders to pay a big price in deal to acquire Covidien. | Media and tech moguls gather in Sun Valley.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2014/07/09/morning-agenda-prosecutors-perfect-streak-ends/", "snippet": "Prosecutors\u2019 winning streak in insider trading cases ends. | Citigroup is said to be near a settlement over mortgage investments. | Medtronic\u2019s shareholders to pay a big price in deal to acquire Covidien. | Media and tech moguls gather in Sun Vall...", "lead_paragraph": "Since the government\u2019s crackdown on insider trading in the hedge fund industry became public in 2009 with the arrest of Raj Rajaratnam, federal prosecutors under Preet Bharara, the United States attorney in Manhattan, had secured 85 insider trading convictions and guilty pleas without one defeat. But on Tuesday, that perfect streak came to an end, Matthew Goldstein, Rachel Abrams and Ben Protess write in DealBook. After just under four hours of deliberation, a federal jury found Rengan Rajaratnam \u2012 the younger brother of Raj Rajaratnam, who was convicted of insider trading in 2011 \u2012 not guilty of conspiracy to commit insider trading with his older brother.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Morning Agenda: Prosecutors\u2019 Perfect Streak Ends", "kicker": "DealBook", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [], "pub_date": "2014-07-09T11:45:42+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Sydney Ember", "person": [{"firstname": "Sydney", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Ember", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/3bd02029-fa62-5bdc-83b7-38bd2c998856", "word_count": 2047, "uri": "nyt://article/3bd02029-fa62-5bdc-83b7-38bd2c998856"}

{"abstract": "Dynegy\u2019s deals look sensible, says Christopher Swann of Reuters Breakingviews, but the lesson from their bankruptcy is to avoid getting carried away.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2014/08/22/dynegys-deals-mark-return-of-ambition/", "snippet": "Dynegy\u2019s deals look sensible, says Christopher Swann of Reuters Breakingviews, but the lesson from their bankruptcy is to avoid getting carried away.", "lead_paragraph": "Dynegy only got out of bankruptcy two years ago. Now two deals worth $6.25 billion, announced on Friday, mark a return of ambition for the power company. It once tried to buy Enron and eventually went bust after a spat involving activist Carl C. {"abstract": "Part safety course, part performance skills clinic and part advertisement, BMW\u2019s Ultimate Driving Experience teaches motorists a car\u2019s limits.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2014/10/16/automobiles/bmw-offers-classes-to-enhance-driving-skills-and-safety.html", "snippet": "Part safety course, part performance skills clinic and part advertisement, BMW\u2019s Ultimate Driving Experience teaches motorists a car\u2019s limits.", "lead_paragraph": "If you own, or are planning to buy, a sports car, you may need instructions on how to use it. {"abstract": "A Saturday brain twister by Barry C. Silk.", "web_url": "https://wordplay.blogs.nytimes.com/2015/02/27/british-bit-of-headwear/", "snippet": "A Saturday brain twister by Barry C. Silk.", "lead_paragraph": "SATURDAY PUZZLE \u2014 A good crossword puzzle will always remind you that you don\u2019t know everything, and that goes double for Saturdays. No matter how much you think you might be up on your lingo, eventually someone will pull a TITFER on you out of nowhere and you\u2019ll realize that there is still much to learn. {"abstract": "Criminals are always seeking ways to hide their profits, and recent cases highlight the difficulty of keeping up with their latest tactics.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/04/business/dealbook/the-challenges-of-fighting-money-laundering.html", "snippet": "Criminals are always seeking ways to hide their profits, and recent cases highlight the difficulty of keeping up with their latest tactics.", "lead_paragraph": "The Watergate credo to \u201cfollow the money\u201d is the reason for a number of laws that require banks, credit unions and money-transmission businesses to keep track of who their customers are and report suspicious transactions. {"abstract": "Smile along with C. W. Stewart.", "web_url": "https://wordplay.blogs.nytimes.com/2015/08/09/smile/", "snippet": "Smile along with C. W. Stewart.", "lead_paragraph": "MONDAY PUZZLE \u2014 Even on a Monday, there has to be a mental separation between the solving of a puzzle and the full understanding of the theme. That gap is where your brain takes all of the theme clues, digests them and then delivers that \u201cAha!\u201d moment that we all know and love. The gap can\u2019t be too short, because that would mean that the theme is too obvious, and that\u2019s no fun. It can\u2019t be too long, because then it wouldn\u2019t be a Monday puzzle. It\u2019s an art to get it just right.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Smile!", "kicker": "Wordplay", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Crossword Puzzles", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2015-08-09T22:00:25+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Crosswords & Games", "byline": {"original": "By Deb Amlen", "person": [{"firstname": "Deb", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Amlen", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/0a2fb793-1c43-506c-965e-c223e2492014", "word_count": 365, "uri": "nyt://article/0a2fb793-1c43-506c-965e-c223e2492014"}

{"abstract": "While activists have been criticized for short-term \u201cquarterly capitalism,\u201d they may hold shares longer than many institutional or retail investors.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/11/05/business/dealbook/headlines-aside-some-activist-investors-take-the-long-view.html", "snippet": "While activists have been criticized for short-term \u201cquarterly capitalism,\u201d they may hold shares longer than many institutional or retail investors.", "lead_paragraph": "Are activist investors short-term traders or in it for the long term? It is the question of the moment as nearly $200 billion has poured into the coffers of activists with names like Icahn, Ackman and Peltz, among others. Last year, as a group they put some 200 companies in their cross hairs and replaced 19 chief executives, according to the law firm Sidley Austin, putting pressure on virtually every board in the {"abstract": "To improve big banks\u2019 reputations, William Dudley told bankers to focus less on searching for \u201cbad apples\u201d than on overhauling their companies\u2019 culture.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/11/06/business/dealbook/new-york-fed-chief-calls-for-improved-wall-street-culture.html", "snippet": "To improve big banks\u2019 reputations, William Dudley told bankers to focus less on searching for \u201cbad apples\u201d than on overhauling their companies\u2019 culture.", "lead_paragraph": "A prominent Wall Street regulator on Thursday continued to press senior bankers to clean up the culture of their firms so that they can avoid the sort of recent scandals that have undermined the reputations of big banks.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "New York Fed Chief Calls for Improved Wall Street Culture", "kicker": null, "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Banking and Financial Institutions", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Regulation and Deregulation of Industry", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Federal Reserve Bank of New York", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Dudley, William C", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2015-11-06T03:09:30+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "DealBook", "byline": {"original": "By Peter Eavis", "person": [{"firstname": "Peter", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Eavis", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/ad5e485e-676e-5d63-9b9e-861596ff63fa", "word_count": 738, "uri": "nyt://article/ad5e485e-676e-5d63-9b9e-861596ff63fa"}

{"abstract": "A fourth-quarter fizzle for most large banks is followed by a steep drop in their market value in the first two weeks of the first quarter.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/01/16/business/dealbook/rocky-road-ahead-for-big-banks.html", "snippet": "A fourth-quarter fizzle for most large banks is followed by a steep drop in their market value in the first two weeks of the first quarter.", "lead_paragraph": "America\u2019s too-big-to-fail cabal is nursing $130 billion in damages. That\u2019s the amount of market value lost by the nation\u2019s top six banks in the last two weeks. The shares of all but Wells Fargo now trade below book value, suggesting stockholders are bracing for a year or more of pain. {"abstract": "The Verizon boss, Lowell McAdam, is betting the deal will help attract digital advertisers by meshing Yahoo with AOL, which Verizon bought last year.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/07/26/business/dealbook/verizon-and-yahoo-internet-also-rans-with-big-hopes.html", "snippet": "The Verizon boss, Lowell McAdam, is betting the deal will help attract digital advertisers by meshing Yahoo with AOL, which Verizon bought last year.", "lead_paragraph": "Verizon is continuing to invest in ancient web history. The telecom company on Monday said it was paying $4.8 billion to buy Yahoo\u2019s core business. It effectively justifies rival T-Mobile\u2019s tongue-in-cheek claim earlier this year that Verizon is having a midlife crisis. The Verizon boss, Lowell McAdam, after all, is betting the deal will help attract digital advertisers by meshing the internet-search firm with AOL, another 1990s highflier that Verizon bought last year.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Verizon and Yahoo: Internet Also-Rans With Big Hopes", "kicker": "Breakingviews", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Online Advertising", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "AOL Inc", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Verizon Communications Inc", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Google Inc", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Yahoo!
